description: Visual and graphic enhancements for support-forge.com including custom icons, hero images, animations, and dynamic elements

userStories.title: Add CSS animation utilities and hover effects
userStories.description: As a developer, I need reusable CSS animation classes for consistent visual effects across the site.
acceptanceCriteria: Create globals.css additions with card hover glow effect (box-shadow with purple #8B5CF6)
Add translateY(-4px) lift effect on card hover with 0.3s transition
Add fade-up animation keyframe for scroll reveals
Add scale hover animation for interactive elements
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Added card-hover, glow-purple, scale-hover classes plus fade-up, pulse-glow, float animations. Includes prefers-reduced-motion support.

userStories.title: Add gradient background system
userStories.description: As a user, I want visual depth in page backgrounds instead of flat colors.
acceptanceCriteria: Add hero-gradient class with linear-gradient(135deg, #050508 0%, #0f0f14 50%, #1a1a2e 100%)
Add radial gradient spotlight overlay using ::before pseudo-element
Add subtle noise texture CSS pattern option
Apply gradient to main layout sections
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Added hero-gradient, section-gradient, surface-gradient, noise-texture, grid-pattern, and glow-orb classes. Application to layout sections deferred to component stories.

userStories.title: Create HeroSection component with image support
userStories.description: As a user, I want visually striking hero sections on each page.
acceptanceCriteria: Create reusable HeroSection component in components/ui/
Props: title, subtitle, backgroundImage (optional), gradient (boolean)
Support responsive image sizes (1920px desktop, 1200px tablet, 1920px mobile)
Include gradient overlay on images for text readability
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Created HeroSection.tsx with size/align props, responsive images via next/image, gradient overlays, and animated text reveals using CSS classes from US-001/US-002.

userStories.title: Add hero section to Homepage
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want an eye-catching hero on the homepage that conveys AI consulting expertise.
acceptanceCriteria: Add HeroSection to homepage with gradient background
Include floating particle/node animation effect using CSS
Hero displays main headline and CTA button
Text has reveal animation on page load
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Added HeroSection with gradient, created FloatingParticles component with animated particles and connection lines, integrated into homepage with CTA buttons and reveal animations.

userStories.title: Update service cards with hover animations
userStories.description: As a user, I want service cards to feel interactive and premium.
acceptanceCriteria: Add glow effect on service card hover (purple box-shadow)
Add slight lift (translateY) on hover
Add animated border effect using gradient
Ensure smooth 0.3s transitions on all effects
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Created .service-card CSS class with animated gradient border using mask-composite technique. Applied to 15 cards: Challenge section (4), Approach section (4), Service pricing (4), Results/testimonials (3).

userStories.title: Add scroll-triggered fade animations
userStories.description: As a user, I want content to animate in as I scroll down the page.
acceptanceCriteria: Create useScrollReveal hook or use Intersection Observer
Add fade-up animation to cards and sections when entering viewport
Stagger animation timing for lists (50-100ms delay between items)
Respect prefers-reduced-motion media query
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Created useScrollReveal and useScrollRevealList hooks using Intersection Observer. Created ScrollReveal and ScrollRevealList wrapper components. Applied to all homepage sections: Challenge (4 cards), Approach (4 cards), Engagement Journey (flow + 3 service cards + advisory), Results (3 testimonials), and CTA. Stagger delay 100ms. prefers-reduced-motion supported.

acceptanceCriteria: Create IconCompetitivePressure component (racing rockets concept)

userStories.notes: Created 4 SVG icon components in components/icons/: IconCompetitivePressure (racing rockets with speed lines), IconROIUncertainty (bar chart with dashed trend line and question mark circle), IconBoardQuestions (presentation screen with 3 speech bubbles containing ?), IconFailedExperiments (cracked gear with floating pieces and reassembly arrows). All use currentColor for theming, support size prop (24/48), use fillOpacity for depth layers.

Replace benefits section icons with new custom components

userStories.notes: Replaced 4 generic inline SVG icons with custom icon components in Service Details section. Discovery (chat icon → IconDiscovery), Assessment (clipboard icon → IconAssessment), Implementation (gear icon → IconImplementation), Advisory (people icon → IconAdvisory). All icons render at size 24 within 48px circular accent containers.

userStories.title: Add animated process flow visualization
userStories.description: As a user, I want the 1→2→3→4 process steps to feel dynamic and engaging.
acceptanceCriteria: Add animated connection lines between process steps
Steps highlight sequentially on scroll into view
Add pulsing indicator on active/current step
Smooth CSS transitions between states
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Created AnimatedProcessFlow component with scroll-triggered sequential reveal using useScrollRevealList hook. Added CSS classes: process-line (traveling light animation), process-step with is-visible state, process-step-active with pulse, step-badge-pulse, process-arrow with bounce. Supports desktop horizontal and mobile vertical layouts. Integrated into Services page Engagement Journey section.

userStories.title: Add count-up animation for statistics
userStories.description: As a user, I want numbers/statistics to animate when scrolling into view.
acceptanceCriteria: Create useCountUp hook or component
Numbers animate from 0 to target value over ~2 seconds
Animation triggers when element enters viewport
Add subtle pulse effect after count completes
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Created CountUp component using Intersection Observer for scroll trigger. Animation uses requestAnimationFrame with easeOutQuart easing for smooth 2s count-up. Includes pulse effect after completion, prefix/suffix support for formatting ($, %, K, weeks), and prefers-reduced-motion accessibility. Applied to 3 homepage statistics: 40%, 3 weeks, $180K.

All use currentColor theming and fillOpacity layering.
